page.title: 03Landscape and Vegetation
page.content: Rothbury is surrounded by hills and moorland where you can see the hardier breeds of sheep such as the "Cheviot" and "Blackface" grazing. Generally the land is fenced but you have to drive carefully because there are places where they can wander onto the road. The Ministry of Defence ranges are on the moorland and there are warning signs. The hills are mainly covered in rough grass, bracken and heather. The soil is acidic because of the peat so plants which like such conditions grow well there. Spent cartridges and rifle shells are often picked up near the Ministry of Defence range but these can be dangerous to handle. There is also a wartime aircraft buried in the peat and a friend of mine has a small piece of it.
